record.title: RECOVERY REBATES AND ECONOMIC STIMULUS FOR THE AMERICAN PEOPLE ACT OF 2008
record.narrative:
RECOVERY REBATES AND ECONOMIC STIMULUS FOR THE AMERICAN PEOPLE ACT OF 2008 -- (Senate - February 05, 2008)

[Page: S656]
record.chair: The Senate will proceed to H.R. 5140, which the clerk will report by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 5140) to provide economic stimulus through recovery rebates to individuals, incentives for business investment, and an increase in conforming and FHA loan limits.
record.chair: AMENDMENT NO. 3983 <center>(Purpose: To provide a perfecting amendment) </center>

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I have an amendment at the desk, and I ask for its consideration.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 3983.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
record.narrative: (The amendment is printed in today's Record under "Text of Amendments.")

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: There appears to be a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I have a cloture motion at the desk.

record.chair: The cloture motion having been presented under rule XXII, the Chair directs the clerk to read the motion.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
Cloture Motion

We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, hereby move to bring to a close debate on amendment No. 3983 to H.R. 5140, the economic stimulus bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now call up a perfecting amendment to the amendment, which is at the desk.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 3984 to amendment No. 3983.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
At the end of the amendment, add the following:
This section shall take effect 4 days after enactment.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now move to commit the bill to the Finance Committee with instructions to report back immediately with an amendment.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] moves to commit H.R. 5140 to the Committee on Finance with instructions to report back forthwith with an amendment numbered 3985.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
At the end insert the following:
This section shall become effective 3 days after enactment of the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: There appears to be a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I have an amendment at the desk, and I ask that it be reported at this time.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 3986 to the instructions of the Reid motion to commit.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: There appears to be a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now call up a second-degree amendment, which is at the desk.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 3987 to amendment No. 3986.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now ask unanimous consent that the mandatory quorum required under rule XXII be waived.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 5140 at 4:30 p.m. tomorrow, Wednesday, February 6; that a vote on the motion to invoke cloture on the Reid first-degree amendment occur at 5:45 p.m., with the time from 4:30 p.m. to 5:45 p.m. be for debate with respect to the cloture motion, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders and their designees, with the final 30 minutes prior to the vote divided 15 minutes each for the Republican leader and the majority leader, with the majority leader controlling the final 15 minutes; and that Members have until 4 p.m. to file any germane second-degree amendments.
If the Senator would withhold.
OK.

Mr. President, reserving the right to object, I ask unanimous consent that the consent be modified so that if cloture is not invoked on the Finance amendment, that amendment be withdrawn and the Senate proceed to a vote on the McConnell-Stevens amendment regarding seniors, veterans, and illegal immigrants, and that following the disposition of these amendments, the bill, as amended, if amended, be read a third time and the Senate proceed to a vote on passage.
Mr. President, I respectfully object to the request.

record.chair: Is there objection to the majority leader's request?
Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
